summary: This is an email from an FBI Victim Specialist in the New York Field Office, following up on an invitation for a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The email seeks confirmation of receipt and offers to contact victims directly, indicating ongoing victim outreach efforts by the FBI in late 2019.

persons.name: Victim Specialist
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the FBI's New York Field Office, is coordinating a meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein and following up on invitation responses.

events.title: FBI follow-up on victim meeting invitation
events.description: An FBI Victim Specialist sends a follow-up email to confirm receipt of an invitation for a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, noting low response rates and offering direct contact.

events.title: Initial contact and invitation planning
events.description: The FBI Victim Specialist had an initial conversation and planned to send an email invitation for a victim meeting by the following Monday.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Field Office was actively organizing a meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019.
The email indicates a low initial response rate to the meeting invitation, prompting direct follow-up.
The correspondence shows the FBI's victim outreach efforts continued after Epstein's death in August 2019.
